TopicTitle: [1.0.5] Adjustable Landing Gear v1.2.0 (mass/cost scaling, tech nodes, drag) - May 30

Articles.Content: Shouldn't the placement of the different sizes (small, medium, large) be moved in the tech tree to be consistent with the stock game's small, medium and large gear? All three sizes of the adjustable gear are currently in the landing node of the tech tree, which contains the stock small gear. The stock medium gear unlocks at advanced landing and the large gear at heavy landing.

I did install both.

Post your output_log.txt from KSP/KSP_Data.

I thought the alignment guide wasn't supposed to exist anymore...

It still works if you have Firespitter. Its just not included with bdanimationmodules alone.

I have the same problem after installing with CKAN - I also have BDarmoury, and that works - so not having the .DLL is out the question.

BDArmory doesn't use BDAnimationModules. I'm not entirely sure how CKAN works but I was told it updates BDAnimationModules as a separate mod. Double check that you have it, or install it manually.

Shouldn't the placement of the different sizes (small, medium, large) be moved in the tech tree to be consistent with the stock game's small, medium and large gear? Update v1.2.0

- Part mass scales with size

- Part cost scales with size

- Placed each gear in proper tech nodes

- Drag eliminated when retracted (stock aero)

- Reverted small particle texture to png

I don't know if there was a better way to do it, but for stock aero, I just completely turned off the drag model for the part when the gear is retracted.

These are now the only landing gears I use for my planes. All the others are far too bleh to use. lol. I would love to see a series of lander legs in this vein. From a small hydraulic leg to a heavy duty shock absorber, with upwards to 50-100mps crash tolerance.

The only thing I really want now are streamlined ones to help out with FAR. Sudden area profile changes can severely affect transonic flight, and the blocky nature of the... containers? (the thing that holds the folded gear) can hamper this.

When i toggle again it does not lag any more!

These gears are great, but I just tried the large ones on my very heavy 175t plane, and the plane lists to one side on the runway about 2 degrees. It was first on one side, and now after adjusting the landing gear position slightly, it's listing onto the other side.

It looks like when the game starts, the plane's mass settles on the gear, but the gear doesn't "give" to the weight equally, one gives more than the other, causing it to list to one side. Is this something I'm doing wrong and any way to fix it?

http://images.akamai.steamusercontent.com/ugc/29618087102167297/A266B1EEBA9A496C181B102660CE579B284F42DB/

http://images.akamai.steamusercontent.com/ugc/29618087102167151/1A3621F818616F66C14C8AD7E0273D6BEB7357B1/

http://images.akamai.steamusercontent.com/ugc/29618087102166980/7A420DF225C74E22AC16B60F3C06EBE9BD88679D/

It looks like when the game starts, the plane's mass settles on the gear, but the gear doesn't "give" to the weight equally, one gives more than the other, causing it to list to one side. Is this something I'm doing wrong and any way to fix it?

Try increasing the spring constant, and reducing the damper. Damper is meant to counter suspension traversal in order to reduce oscillations in the spring. If you set it too high in comparison to the spring strength, it may never fully achieve an even equilibrium. To support heavier craft, you want to increase the spring constant first before increasing damping.

In fact, the game is lagging when i select the adjustment button for main gears, that means for 2 gears, left and right

When i select adjustment for the front gear, which is alone, there's no lagging.

Very strange!!

Thanks for the explanation, Bahamuto! With 100 spring and 0 or 1 damper, it's now only listing by about 0.5 degrees, which is a lot better than before

But is there a way to make them even more rigid?
Hey, another quick thing - it's hard to get the gears tall enough. Even the large gear at full wheel height is actually shorter than the LY-99.

I'd like to second the wish for landing legs in this vein. I'd really like to see some landing legs designed to be attached to the bottom of the craft, and fold up into the body in the same manner the landing gear does.

The BDAnimationModules.dll you have with the CKAN package doesn't match what is on Kerbal Stuff. I installed using CKAN and it did not work at all... I dropped in the DLL from the zip on Kerbalstuff and it works fine now.
